summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from August 6, 2019, discussing logistical planning for a search warrant execution on Jeffrey Epstein's private island off St. Thomas. The emails coordinate agent availability and travel plans for the operation, which was scheduled for the following weekend.

persons.name: G. (NY) (FBI)
persons.context: An FBI agent in the New York office who is coordinating availability for the planned search of Epstein's island, noting they need to be back by the close of business on Friday.

persons.name: SSA Squad C-20 Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking FI3I New York office
persons.context: The sender of the initial email outlining the tentative plan for the search warrant execution on Epstein's island, including travel and operational details.

connections.person2: SSA Squad C-20 Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking FI3I New York office
connections.description: Both are FBI agents in the New York office coordinating on the logistics for the search warrant operation on Epstein's island.

events.title: Search Warrant Sworn Out in St. Thomas
events.description: The Southern District of New York (SDNY) was drafting a search warrant affidavit for Epstein's island, with the expectation it would be sworn out on Friday in St. Thomas.

events.title: Planned FBI Travel to Epstein's Island
events.description: Tentative plan for FBI agents to fly out on the FBI Q400 plane to St. Thomas to execute the search warrant on Epstein's private island.
personsInvolved: SSA Squad C-20 Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking FI3I New York office

events.title: Search of Epstein's Island
events.description: The search of Epstein's island off St. Thomas, managed by the FBI's Evidence Response Team (ERT), was expected to take 1-3 days.

events.title: Planned FBI Travel Home
events.description: The tentative travel day home for the FBI agents after completing the search of Epstein's island.
personsInvolved: SSA Squad C-20 Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking FI3I New York office

keyFacts: The Southern District of New York (SDNY) was drafting a search warrant affidavit for Jeffrey Epstein's private island off St. Thomas in August 2019.
The FBI's Evidence Response Team (ERT) was scheduled to manage a 1-3 day search of the island, indicating a significant evidence-gathering operation.
FBI agents from the New York office, specifically from Squad C-20 (Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking), were planning to travel via an FBI Q400 plane for the operation.
The email chain shows active, high-level coordination within the FBI for a major investigative action against Epstein shortly before his death in custody.
